concept: Advanced scheduling, disk scheduling, multithreading models and RAID basics.

challenges.question: Which scheduling algorithm aims to minimize average waiting time (assuming all jobs are known in advance)?
challenges.explanation: SJF is provably optimal for minimizing average waiting time given complete knowledge.

challenges.question: In multithreading models, the 'many-to-one' model has which major drawback?

options.B: If one thread blocks, the entire process blocks

challenges.explanation: Many-to-one maps all user threads onto one kernel thread, so blocking affects all.

challenges.question: The SCAN disk scheduling algorithm is also known as:
challenges.explanation: SCAN moves like an elevator, servicing in one direction then reversing.

challenges.question: RAID 1 (Mirroring) primarily provides:
challenges.explanation: RAID 1 mirrors data across disks to survive disk failures.

challenges.question: Which of the following is an advantage of microkernel design?

options.A: All services run in kernel mode for speed
options.B: Better modularity and easier to maintain/extend

challenges.explanation: Microkernels move services to user space, improving modularity and reliability.

challenges.question: Which of the following is used for asynchronous event handling from hardware?
challenges.explanation: Hardware interrupts notify the CPU/OS about external events.

challenges.question: Copy-on-write is an optimization technique used mainly for:
challenges.explanation: COW lets parent and child share pages until one writes to them.

challenges.question: Which disk scheduling algorithm always chooses the request closest to the current head position?
In demand paging, a page fault occurs when:

options.B: Requested page is not in main memory

challenges.explanation: Page fault triggers loading the page from secondary storage into memory.

challenges.question: TLB (Translation Lookaside Buffer) is:

options.B: A cache for page table entries

challenges.explanation: TLB stores recent translations from virtual to physical addresses.
